infodynamics.measures.discrete
Class BlockEntropyCalculator

java.lang.Object
  infodynamics.measures.discrete.InfoMeasureCalculator
      infodynamics.measures.discrete.EntropyCalculator
          infodynamics.measures.discrete.BlockEntropyCalculator
All Implemented Interfaces:
SingleAgentMeasure
public class BlockEntropyCalculator
extends EntropyCalculator

Computes entropy over blocks of consecutive states in time. Implemented separately from the single state entropy calculator to allow the single state calculator to have optimal performance. Usage: 1. Continuous accumulation of observations: Call: a. initialise() b. addObservations() several times over c. computeLocalFromPreviousObservations() 2. Standalone: Call: localActiveInformation()

Author:
Joseph Lizier

initialise

public void initialise()
Initialise calculator, preparing to take observation sets in Should be called prior to any of the addObservations() methods. You can reinitialise without needing to create a new object.

Overrides:
initialise in class EntropyCalculator

addObservations

public void addObservations(int[][] states)
Add observations in to our estimates of the pdfs. This call suitable only for homogeneous agents, as all agents will contribute to single pdfs.

Specified by:
addObservations in interface SingleAgentMeasure
Overrides:
addObservations in class EntropyCalculator
Parameters:
states - 1st index is time, 2nd index is agent number

addObservations

public void addObservations(int[][] states,
                            int col)
Add observations for a single agent of the multi-agent system to our estimates of the pdfs. This call should be made as opposed to addObservations(int states[][]) for computing active info for heterogeneous agents.
